alert.note: Alert for Phillips (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 05 at 3:10PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Phillips County through 345 PM CDT... At 310 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near White River National Wildlife Refuge, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Elaine, White River National Wildlife Refuge, Lake View, Mellwood, Lambrook, Wabash, Modoc, Catron, Ratio, Oneida, Hoop Spur and Ewal. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for eastern Arkansas...and northwestern Mississippi.
